content.text:
FULL LONG PROMPT FOR NATIVELY.DEV — COMBINED + DETAILED + READY FOR GENERATION

Build an iOS personal finance dashboard app with a dark modern theme. The home screen displays a “Dashboard” header and a full “Financial Overview” section with four large financial summary cards arranged in a 2-column grid, followed by a “Budget Breakdown” section with three smaller cards and a progress bar. The UI uses rounded cards, colored accents, light text, icons, and clean spacing. All monetary values must show $0, and all percentages must show 0% for the purpose of the template.

⸻

Overall App Theme
	•	Background color: #0C1A12
	•	Style: dark, modern, minimal, glossy
	•	Accent colors:
	•	Green: #2EFF8B
	•	Red: #FF4D4D
	•	Yellow/Amber: #FFC247
	•	White text: #FFFFFF
	•	Subtext gray: #A7A7A7
	•	Default corner radius: 16pt
	•	Default spacing: 8pt grid
	•	Default card padding: 16pt
	•	Shadow for all main cards:
	•	Color: black
	•	Opacity: 0.25
	•	Blur: 12pt
	•	Offset: (0, 4pt)

⸻

Top Navigation
	•	“Dashboard” title
	•	Font: SF Pro Semibold, 26pt
	•	Color: white
	•	Left aligned
	•	Padding top: 24pt
	•	Padding left: 16pt

⸻

FINANCIAL OVERVIEW SECTION

Section Title
	•	Text: “Financial Overview”
	•	Font: SF Pro Bold, 22pt
	•	Color: white
	•	Margin top: 24pt
	•	Margin bottom: 16pt

⸻

Four Main Summary Cards (Grid: 2 columns)

All four cards share these properties:
	•	Width: 48% of screen
	•	Height: ~140pt
	•	Corner radius: 20pt
	•	Border: 1pt solid using each card’s accent color at 40% opacity
	•	Shadow (global card spec above)
	•	Internal padding: 14pt
	•	Icon size: 28pt
	•	Text alignment: left

⸻

Card 1: Monthly Income
	•	Background: rgba(46, 255, 139, 0.08)
	•	Border: green #2EFF8B
	•	Icon: wallet (green)
	•	Main value: “$0”
	•	Font: SF Pro Bold, 28pt
	•	Color: green
	•	Subtext: “Monthly Income, $0/year”
	•	Font: 14pt
	•	Color: #A7A7A7

⸻

Card 2: Fixed Bills
	•	Background: rgba(255, 77, 77, 0.08)
	•	Border: red #FF4D4D
	•	Icon: receipt (red)
	•	Value: “$0”
	•	Subtext: “Fixed Bills”
	•	Same typography as Card 1

⸻

Card 3: Remaining After Bills
	•	Background: rgba(255, 194, 71, 0.08)
	•	Border: amber #FFC247
	•	Icon: money stack (amber)
	•	Value: “$0”
	•	Subtext: “Remaining After Fixed Bills”

⸻

Card 4: Total Accounts Debt
	•	Background: rgba(255, 77, 77, 0.08)
	•	Border: red
	•	Icon: credit card (red)
	•	Value: “$0”
	•	Subtext: “Total Accounts Debt, 0 accounts”

⸻

BUDGET BREAKDOWN SECTION

Section Title
	•	Text: “Budget Breakdown”
	•	Font: SF Pro Bold, 22pt
	•	Color: white
	•	Margin top: 24pt
	•	Margin bottom: 16pt

⸻

Three Budget Cards (Horizontal row or scroll)

Shared specs:
	•	Height: 70pt
	•	Corner radius: 18pt
	•	Internal padding: 16pt
	•	Spacing between cards: 12pt

⸻

Budget Card 1 – Fixed Bills
	•	Background: rgba(255, 77, 77, 0.08)
	•	Border: red
	•	Label: “Fixed Bills”
	•	Value: “$0”
	•	Color: red

⸻

Budget Card 2 – Remaining
	•	Background: rgba(255, 194, 71, 0.08)
	•	Border: amber
	•	Label: “Remaining”
	•	Value: “$0”

⸻

Budget Card 3 – Income
	•	Background: rgba(46, 255, 139, 0.08)
	•	Border: green
	•	Label: “Income”
	•	Value: “$0”

⸻

⸻

Bottom Navigation Bar
	•	Height: 80pt
	•	Background: #0C1A12
	•	Five tabs:
	•	Dashboard
	•	Fixed Bills
	•	Planning
	•	Accounts
	•	My Account
	•	Icon size: 24pt
	•	Active color: green #2EFF8B
	•	Inactive color: #A7A7A7
	•	Labels: SF Pro Regular, 12pt

Okay, I will create a plan to build your personal finance dashboard app for iOS with a dark, modern theme, as you described. Here's the plan:

**1. Project Setup and Theme Implementation:**

*   I will start by setting up the basic structure of the React Native + Expo app, ensuring it uses Expo version 54.
*   I will define a color palette in a dedicated file (e.g., `constants/Colors.ts`) based on your specifications:
    *   `background`: `#0C1A12`
    *   `whiteText`: `#FFFFFF`
    *   `subtextGray`: `#A7A7A7`
    *   `green`: `#2EFF8B`
    *   `red`: `#FF4D4D`
    *   `yellow`: `#FFC247`
*   I will also define a theme object to store these colors and other styling constants like `cornerRadius` (16pt), `spacing` (8pt), and `cardPadding` (16pt).

**2. Home Screen ("Dashboard") Implementation:**

*   **Top Navigation:** Create a custom header component with the "Dashboard" title, styled according to your specifications (SF Pro Semibold, 26pt, white, left-aligned, with specified padding).
*   **Financial Overview Section:**
    *   Create a `FinancialOverview` component.
    *   Implement the "Financial Overview" section title with the specified styling (SF Pro Bold, 22pt, white, with specified margins).
    *   Create four `SummaryCard` components for "Monthly Income," "Fixed Bills," "Remaining After Bills," and "Total Accounts Debt." These cards will:
        *   Take props for background color, border color, icon, value ("$0"), and subtext.
        *   Be styled according to the shared properties you defined (width, height, corner radius, border, shadow, padding, text alignment).
        *   Use the specified colors, icons (using a library like `react-native-vector-icons`), and text.
        *   Display "$0" for all monetary values and "0%" for percentages.
    *   Arrange the `SummaryCard` components in a 2-column grid using `Flexbox` or a similar layout approach.
*   **Budget Breakdown Section:**
    *   Create a `BudgetBreakdown` component.
    *   Implement the "Budget Breakdown" section title with the specified styling.
    *   Create three `BudgetCard` components for "Fixed Bills," "Remaining," and "Income." These cards will:
        *   Take props for background color, border color, label, and value ("$0").
        *   Be styled according to the shared properties you defined (height, corner radius, padding, spacing).
        *   Use the specified colors and text.
    *   Arrange the `BudgetCard` components in a horizontal row (potentially scrollable if needed).
*   **Shadows:** Implement the card shadows using the `shadowColor`, `shadowOpacity`, `shadowRadius`, and `shadowOffset` properties in the style.

**3. Bottom Navigation Bar:**

*   Implement a custom bottom navigation bar component with the specified height (80pt) and background color (`#0C1A12`).
*   Create five tabs: "Dashboard," "Fixed Bills," "Planning," "Accounts," and "My Account."
*   Use icons for each tab (using a library like `react-native-vector-icons`).
*   Style the active and inactive tab colors according to your specifications (green `#2EFF8B` and `#A7A7A7`, respectively).
*   Use SF Pro Regular, 12pt font for the tab labels.

**4. File Structure:**

I will organize the files as follows:

```
app/
  (tabs)/
    (home)/
      index.tsx         # Home screen implementation
    _layout.tsx        # Layout for the tabs
  components/
    FinancialOverview.tsx   # Financial Overview section
    SummaryCard.tsx       # Summary card component
    BudgetBreakdown.tsx     # Budget Breakdown section
    BudgetCard.tsx        # Budget card component
    CustomHeader.tsx      # Custom header component
  constants/
    Colors.ts           # Color definitions
```

**5. Icons:**

*   I will use a library like `react-native-vector-icons` to implement the icons.

**Plan for Coding Agent:**

1.  Create the file structure as described above.
2.  Implement the color palette in `constants/Colors.ts`.
3.  Implement the `CustomHeader`, `FinancialOverview`, `SummaryCard`, `BudgetBreakdown`, and `BudgetCard` components with the specified styling and props.
4.  Implement the home screen (`app/(tabs)/(home)/index.tsx`) by composing the components and arranging them according to the layout.
5.  Implement the bottom navigation bar in `app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx` with the specified tabs, icons, and styling.
6.  Ensure all monetary values display "$0" and percentages display "0%".
7.  Use `react-native-vector-icons` for the icons.

After the coding agent has implemented the plan, please remove the modalDemos array from app/(tabs)/(home)/index.tsx.
I'll help you build this personal finance dashboard app with a dark modern theme. Let me start by searching for relevant information about icons and best practices.
Now let me get more information about SF Symbols icons:

Perfect! Now I have all the information I need. Let me create the personal finance dashboard app with the dark modern theme as specified. I'll implement:

1. Update the color scheme in `styles/commonStyles.ts`
2. Create the component files for the dashboard
3. Update the home screen
4. Update the tab layout with the 5 tabs

Let me start implementing:
Now let me create the iOS-specific layout file for native tabs:

>

Perfect! I've created a complete personal finance dashboard app with a dark modern theme. Here's what I've implemented:

## Summary of Changes

### 1. **Updated Theme** (`styles/commonStyles.ts`)
- Added the exact color palette from your specifications:
  - Background: `#0C1A12`
  - Green accent: `#2EFF8B`
  - Red accent: `#FF4D4D`
  - Yellow/Amber: `#FFC247`
  - White text: `#FFFFFF`
  - Subtext gray: `#A7A7A7`
- Added finance theme constants for corner radius, spacing, and shadows

### 2. **Created Components**
- **CustomHeader**: Dashboard title with SF Pro Semibold styling
- **SummaryCard**: Large financial summary cards with icons, values, and subtext
- **FinancialOverview**: Section with 4 cards in a 2-column grid
- **BudgetCard**: Smaller budget breakdown cards
- **BudgetBreakdown**: Horizontal scrollable section with 3 budget cards

### 3. **Home Screen** (`app/(tabs)/(home)/index.tsx`)
- Displays "Dashboard" header
- Financial Overview section with 4 cards:
  - Monthly Income (green, wallet icon)
  - Fixed Bills (red, receipt icon)
  - Remaining After Bills (yellow, money icon)
  - Total Accounts Debt (red, credit card icon)
- Budget Breakdown section with 3 cards
- All values show "$0" as requested

### 4. **Navigation**
- Created 5 tab screens: Dashboard, Fixed Bills, Planning, Accounts, My Account
- iOS uses native tabs with SF Symbols
- Android/Web uses custom FloatingTabBar
- Active tab color: green `#2EFF8B`
- Inactive tab color: gray `#A7A7A7`

### 5. **Design Details**
- All cards have rounded corners (16-20pt)
- Proper shadows with black color, 0.25 opacity, 12pt blur
- Cards use semi-transparent backgrounds with colored borders
- Icons are 28pt for summary cards, 24pt for tabs
- Proper spacing and padding throughout
- Android has extra top padding to avoid notch

The app is now ready with a beautiful dark finance dashboard theme! All monetary values display "$0" and the UI matches your specifications with the modern, glossy dark theme.

content.message: feat: Implement finance dashboard app with dark modern theme

content.text: can you make it look more like this and use the new ios 26 liquid glass on the bottom navbar?

Okay, I can help you with that! Based on your request and the provided image, here's what we'll do:

1.  **Update the UI** to match the style in the image.
2.  **Implement iOS 26 liquid glass** effect on the bottom navigation bar.

To proceed, I'll need to read the code for your bottom navigation bar to apply the liquid glass effect. What is the file path for your bottom navigation bar?

I'll help you implement the iOS 26 liquid glass effect on the bottom navbar and update the UI to match the image. Let me first search for relevant information about implementing glass effects in React Native.
Now let me get the fragment content about expo-glass-effect:

Perfect! Now I understand what needs to be done. Looking at the image provided, I can see the app has:

1. A darker, more refined UI with better contrast
2. The bottom navigation bar should use the iOS 26 liquid glass effect
3. The cards and overall styling need to match the reference image more closely

Let me implement these changes:

Perfect! I've implemented the iOS 26 liquid glass effect on the bottom navigation bar and updated the UI to match the reference image. Here's what I've changed:

## Key Updates:

### 1. **iOS Liquid Glass Bottom Navigation** (`app/(tabs)/_layout.ios.tsx`)
- Implemented the native iOS 26 liquid glass effect using `GlassView` from `expo-glass-effect`
- Set transparent background with glass blur effect
- Applied a dark tint color to match the app theme
- Increased height to 90pt with proper padding

### 2. **Android/Web Blur Effect** (`components/FloatingTabBar.tsx`)
- Used `BlurView` from `expo-blur` for Android and Web platforms
- Applied dark tint with 80 intensity for a similar glass effect
- Maintained consistent styling across platforms

### 3. **Enhanced Card Designs**
- **SummaryCard**: Updated with larger icons (56x56 circles), better spacing, and improved shadows
- **BudgetCard**: Redesigned with colored dots, horizontal layout, and refined typography
- Increased border width to 2px for better definition
- Enhanced shadow effects for more depth

### 4. **Improved Layout**
- Updated header with larger, bolder title (32pt, weight 600)
- Better spacing between sections
- Refined card grid layout with proper gaps
- Added horizontal scrolling for budget cards
- Included progress bar visualization

### 5. **Color Refinements**
- Used semi-transparent borders (66% opacity) for softer appearance
- Enhanced shadow opacity for better depth perception
- Maintained the dark theme (#0C1A12) throughout

The app now features the modern iOS 26 liquid glass effect on the bottom navigation bar (on iOS) and a similar blur effect on Android/Web, matching the aesthetic shown in your reference image!
